data.title: Great Dinner and Drinks Spot
data.text: I came here with my husband and we had a reservation but arrived a little early so went upstairs to their bar.  It's a small space, and in a 200 year old building, feels very intimate and like a destination, not just a cookie cutter place for dinner.  They are super friendly and make you feel at home.  We had a cocktail and decided we wanted to eat upstairs so they moved us to a table and we had a wonderful l dinner.  The servers were all extremely attentive, we basically had two of them, who both went above and beyond explaining food and cocktail recipes to us.  My husband is gluten and dairy free and they were very helpful about his needs.  They also knew we were just visiting and recently married and brought us some champagne at the end of the meal.  It felt like an experience being there more than just a run of the mill dinner and I highly recommend stopping in if you find yourself in the area and like a long leisurely dining experience.

data.title: Would have expected more...
data.text: While the ribeye was cooked perfect, it lacked seasoning and my potatoes were cold and looked like they were out of a box for $38.00, my guests shrimp and grits were cooked well but in his case overdone with the seasoning; and as far as service we ended up with the the slooow guy... A bit of a let down for the time & $ after reading some of the better reviews

owner_response.author: Jessica C, General Manager at Magnolia's On King, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for choosing Magnolia's on King for dinner. We do apologize for the lapses in service and the standards of the food. Our chef and team work very hard to please all our patrons with our dishes, we do appreciate the feedback. The lapses in service is not in line with either our sevice standards or the sense of our Southern Hospitality we mean to convey to our guests. 

I would like for you consider giving us a second chance to make it better for you. Along with givinig us a another chance, I would like to give you a gift card as an incentive to return to give us another opportunity to serve you.

I look forward to hearing for you. I am also providing my direct email for your use.

Sincerely,

Brandon Scott / Service Director / brandon@magnoliasonking.com

data.title: what a lovely little restaurant
data.text:
beautiful  little bistro type restaurant with a good menu and food as well. the front
windows allow alot of light and great people watching.

data.title: Thought I would love it...
data.text: A friend who lives in Alexandria recommended this restaurant.  He reserved a table, although there was a lot of effort getting us to our table in a reasonable amount of time.  The vibe of the place is good, but the service was perhaps a bit "too friendly"...jokes about roofied drinks when two married couples are dining is a bit weird.  I ordered the shrimp and grits...they were okay, but having lived in coastal South Carolina for a time, they were pretty blah in my opinion.  The stuffed dates were excellent, although they overcharged us for these (we ordered only one, but they brought us two and charged us for two despite saying that the second order was on the house).  It was a good evening catching up with friends, but the food was only mediocre.

data.title: Weekend brunch at Magnolia's
data.text:
My husband and I were spending the weekend in Old Town and stumbled in Magnolia's on King for brunch. The maitre d' and our server were friendly and welcoming. The menu had an interesting array of choices -- blackened rockfish and grits, bananas Foster French toast and crabmeat eggs Benedict -- along with the tried and true brunch stand-bys. The only disappointment was the French press coffee: weak and flavorless. 

We were seated near the front window which gave us a great view of the parade of dogs being walked in this dog-friendly city. The free King Street trolley passes by every 15 minutes so it's a good option for those taking the Metro in from the District. I'd like to try dinner at Magnolia's on King the next time we're in town.

data.title: Awesome shrimp and grits!
data.text: During a recent visit to DC we stopped for dinner in Alexandria after touring Mount Vernon.  Magnolia's is a charming restaurant with a varied menu and helpful staff.  The shrimp and grits was "off the charts" delicious and definitely the best that I have ever had.  My son enjoyed his fish and grits and my husband liked the pork chop which was huge.  We had the spicy crab dip for an appetizer and highly recommend that as a great starter to an excellent meal.  The location is good and this place is well worth a visit.

data.title: Southern Hospitality
data.text: We had the most amazing Brunch EVER!!  We arrived a little early because we heard this small restaurant fills up quickly on a Sunday.  As we were waiting outside, the waitress let us in early, showed us a table, told us to make ourselves at home while she went to put her uniform on.  I am terrible with names but she was the sweetest thing ever.  (Yeah, you know who I mean) She gave us great recommendations and when I said that I didn't care too much for mimosas cause of the OJ, she fixed me one with crushed berries.  Awesome.  She also suggested the dates stuffed with blue cheese and wrapped with bacon.  Heaven!! And the Eggs Benedict were absolutely fabulous with the smoky cheese grits.  The fruit in the fruit cup was perfectly ripened (My pet peeve is fruit that is crunchy UGH).  My only regret was that my stomach wasn't big enough to try the Bananas Foster French Toast!!  Okay, my 2nd regret was not getting the Bloody Mary my husband had with the duck infused Vodka.  OOOOOOOH  it was so good.  I am dying to come back for dinner!!  Thanks for such a lovely Brunch and the great service.

data.title: Delicious and Welcoming
data.text:
The atmosphere is welcoming, the staff helpful and  friendly and the food delicious.
We went during Restaurant Week and the selections for that menu were outstanding.
The stuffed dates and the BBQ duck on Grits was delicious. The roasted chicken and pork dish were very good. The selections of  sides are also very good and delicious.
The pecan pie was grand.  We will be returning!

data.title: So, so good!
data.text:
Went there with friends as part of "Restaurant Week."  We ordered the three types of appetizers offered (crab dip, duck bbq, and stuffed dates.  They all were excellent...especially the dates.  For dinners, we tried the grilled skirt steak, the fish/grits, and the chicken. Having tried all my friends' dinners, I personally think the skirt steak was the best. The steak was tender and the veggies that came with it were awesome.  The fish/grits was a bit spicy for my taste and I didn't expect cheese grits to have such a "kick."  We tried three desserts, too...the coconut cake, the bread pudding, and the pecan pie (with the maple bacon ice cream). Of all those, the pecan pie was the best.  But, that's just me...I'm not much of a fan of bread pudding or coconut cake. They both were good, though...just not my thing.

We ordered cocktails, too.  This was probably the worst part of our experience.  While they were good, too, they were quite small and rather expensive (at least for me) with a cocktail being $12 and wine being $11. But, on the other hand, they were jam-packed with liquor!  

However, the thing that made Magnolia's on King the best was the greeting we received at the door and the very attentive (not overbearing) waitress we had.  I'm sorry I forgot her name, but she was excellent.  The setting is great...classy, but not overly fancy or uncomfortable; small but not cramped; and just a very pleasant experience.  We all decided that we would come back there, even when Restaurant Week was over!

data.title: Good food over all, still working on finer touches
data.text: This week is Restaurant Week in Alexandria so we decided to give Magnolia's a spin. All in all, I definitely recommend the spot! The food is solidly good. But there are some hits and misses which explains the rating. First things first: With our reservation, we were seated on the second floor near the bar area. That area maybe okay for brunch or earlier in the day, but definitely stay away from it in the evening on the weekends. In short, it became a nightmare because of the noise(we could barely hear each other speaking). They have an odd configuration outside of the bar area where it's a strange lounge with people sitting and yelling and talking in an open seating area next to the dining area. On top of that, they were moving the dining tables around while you're trying to eat. Odd! The first floor seem to be more ambient and it also had white tablecloths; at the same time, we noticed that the first floor was much warmer when we came in. MUCH warmer! As for the food itself, some of it was absolutely divine and other dishes were misses. The crab dip and the Caesar salad are worth the price of admission alone! They have perfected both of these appetizers. The smoked chicken is nicely seasoned and delicious as well, though it would be great to have better green vegetables on the side. The fish and grits is definitely going to be a surprise for people looking for a certain style of urban, southern comfort food. Spoiler: this ain't it! The grits are a very coarse, chunky hominy that tasted very much like a rich, creamed corn. The cheese flavor was absent all together. While the Rockfish had a nice flavor and seasoning, this dish did not resemble any traditional Southern fish and grits that I've ever seen or tasted. I definitely would not recommend it unless you really want to try a very haute take on the dish. The pecan pie dessert was okay/average. As for service, it started out really amazing but as the evening went on, our waiter kind of disappeared for a while. All of their staff were very nice and accommodating though, so I will definitely return. I will just do so knowing what to order and where to be seated to have a more enjoyable experience.

data.title: Familiar taste of southern charm in Alexandria
data.text:
Headed in to King Street on the recommendation of a co-worker while traveling to Reston for work. Great area to walk around and enjoy historic America! Checked out a few menus and settled on Magnolia. 

Service was good, minimal contact, but prompt and polite. Started with drinks, great beer selection and cocktail list was creative, but familiar. Went with their signature old fashion (my fav), fantastic, very smooth! Loved the HUGE single ice cube that took up most of the glass and kept my cocktail cold, but not watered down. 

All the apps and entrees sounded good, went with the smoked 1/2 chicken with maple bacon green beans and sweet potato. Excellent choice, perfect smoky flavor and the meat was still tender and juicy. My colleague had the skirt steak at the servers recommendation, she said normally she would finish everything on her plate, but tonight was the exception. We also decided to share the Mac and Cheese side, because, why not?! I've had lots of "fancy" M&C before, but honestly this was one of my favorites. The cheese was creamy, but not overly heavy, and there was plenty of real cheese that stayed stringy as the fork pulled the macaroni away from from its friends to be devoured :) no additional ingredients needed in this M&C. 

Very nice atmosphere and great dinner music playing (lots of Frank)... Good for a date. 

Enjoy and don't forget to order the M&C or your missing out.

data.title: Amazing dinner
data.text: Service was out of this world. Food was excellent - highly recommend this restaurant in Old Alexandria. We tried Chimichurri Skirt Steak, shrimp and grits and an amazing rhubarb pie.  The house drinks were also fun and our favorites were the Enchantress and the New Fashioned.  With a great ambience to top it off it was a great night.

data.title: Worth your time
data.text:
I took my husband to Magnolia's On King for his birthday after quickly scanning some reviews. Boy am I glad to have booked a reservation. The restaurant is right in the middle of vibrant Old Town Alexandria. If you sneeze you may miss it because it's a slender restaurant in the midst of centuries old buildings.

The food is Southern fusion and isn't at all fussy or overdone. There are mini corn bread muffins served at the start with a butter infused with something delightful I couldn't make out. We had the spicy crab dip and had to avoid licking our fingers in public. He ordered the shrimp and grits and it was the best I've ever tasted. But be forewarned it is spicy so if your stomach isn't fit for spice then choose something else. I chose the skirt steak and was happy for my selection; it was done perfectly. The bread pudding is firm, so if you're not typically a fan of bread pudding put your trust in theirs. And if you choose the pecan pie ask them to heat it because otherwise it will be served room temperature according to their standard.

The restaurant is quaint, bright, modern and tasteful. It is also quite intimate; there must be about 12-15 tables in total. The service is  spot on and I liked the attention to detail at Magnolia On King.

If you are in the Washington, DC area and need some inspired choices for dinner, I highly recommend this restaurant! And we will absolutely be returning.

data.title: Fabulous!
data.text: My husband and I had dinner here last night. He had the fish and grits and I had shrimp and grits. I thought I was in Charleston, SC. It was that good. Very nice atmosphere, the service was great, and Sinatra tunes playing in the background. A definite hit!

data.title: Between average and very good
data.text: We decided to explore Old Town Alexandria on our recent trip to DC, so I made reservations for dinner at Magnolia's on King. We sat upstairs where it was more lively and loud, but we were given the choice to sit in the quieter downstairs dining area. What fun would that be?!  The staff was friendly and pretty attentive. Drink selection was good, but our choices tasted just okay. The menu is limited, but we found several items that looked good to order. The crab dip was good, but not enough crab and too much cheese. Several people offered us additional bread for the dip, but it never materialized. The stuffed dates were delicious and so was the rockfish and grits. My husbands skirt steak was okay and undercooked. We didn't stay for dessert and decided to explore elsewhere.

data.title: Craft cocktails in the Palm Lounge- yes, please!
data.text: My husband and I really enjoyed our date night here. Those bartenders know what they are doing! We snagged the high table in the corner near the upstairs bar and had a great time trying the small plates and various cocktails. Everything was delicious except we were not thrilled with the beignets. If you have ever had New Orleans  Café du Monde beignets, these were a far cry, but still a valiant effort, but the coffee ice cream served alongside it and on the same plate was way too strong. I notice they are no longer on the menu, so perhaps others voiced the same opinion. Definitely recommend the pulled BBQ Duck and the Stuffed Dates, and the Fire and Ice cocktail with tequila and watermelon juice was a taste sensation!

data.title: Book into the Palm Lounge for cocktails and appetizers
data.text: We had very attentive service in this small upstairs bar area.  We had booked a table - there are also bar stools and sofas by the fireplace.  Excellent appetizers  - we decided to share the crab dip and the bacon wrapped dates, accompanied by wine or something from the uniquely crafted cocktail range.  All excellent. I can imagine this would be a cozy place in the wintertime with the fire going.  It is also a good space for private events. Good to have another choice in Old Town!

data.title: Lovely and Understated
data.text:
I took my adult daughter here for a quiet birthday dinner, and that is what we got.  The downstairs dining room is beautifully appointed with some artwork of Magnolia trees.

The waitstaff is amiable, efficient, and helpful.  Food presentation is good, although the menu is sparse .  I understand that it changers frequently, so that is a good thing.

My seared salmon was delish as was the Caesar salad with fried sardines.  Unusual but tasty.

We enjoyed all.

data.title: Great Cocktail Spot (Upstairs = The Palm Lounge)
data.text: There's no shortage of cocktail bars and speakeasy in the DC/NoVa area but you should be sure to visit this spot. The upstairs room has a sophisticated design and the bar is small. Perfect for meeting a friend or a date. Our bartender was Nick and we're big fans of him after the first visit! Nick went over the menu with us and helped us pick a drink. The small bites were awesome! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Highly recommend.

data.title: Classy New Restaurant
data.text: We had dinner there shortly after this restaurant opened; it lived up to the lofty reviews I'd heard from other diners.  We had a first class meal with southern flair.  I heard that the lounge upstairs is also wonderful, but haven't had an opportunity to try it yet.
